Reviews.Title: Easy to use HUGE screen all kind of features
Reviews.Author: K. Evert "revertmastec"
Reviews.Content: I was a product tester for this camera before it was released. This is one of the most user friendly cameras to date. It delivers great pictures has the biggest touch screen I've seen on a digital camera and it is packed with more features in the camera than you will use. The rechargeable battery lasted a long time and that was with me playing with the editing software. The movies camera takes good movies but does need improvement in the audio. Overall a great camera that you will not be disappointed in. get yourself a memory card as the internal memory only holds 5 pictures set on 8MP.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Joseph T. Reeves "Retired Air Force Member"
Reviews.Content: We just bought this camera and have tested most of the features.  We love the touch screen.  After a couple of tries, we were finally able to download the video to our computer.  It turns out that there is an option on the camera that you have to set to "disk" if you have a memory card installed instead of using the camera's internal memory to store photos/video.  Once we changed that option on the camera, we were quickly able to connect the camera to the computer and download our video.  We like the "burst" feature on the camera but have been unable to figure out why it only works without the flash activated.  Guess we'll have to keep reading the users manual to figure that one out.  We have not had any problems with the LCD screen freezing and are hoping that was an isolated incident and that we don't have to send our camera back.

Reviews.Title: It's Worth Every Penny and It's Idiot Proof!
Reviews.Author: P. A. Wiles
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!! When I decided to purchase a digital camera, I did all the research and fully intended to buy something else. But this camera caught my eye. It was just the right size, lightweight and great looking. It didn't have all those tricky wheels and knobs that are on so many digital cameras. Honestly, the thought of having to put on my reading glasses to see how to take a picture was a real turn-off on most of the cameras I looked at - but this HP is easy enough to use that I don't need to bother. Besides, with the large touch screen, all of the photo sections and choices are easy to see and even easier to use! Attached to the camera strap is a neat little 'tapper' gizmo - a great alternative to using your finger which can sometimes leave a smear on the screen. This camera was so easy that I learned how to use it before leaving the store!  I bought a 1GB card and get more than 250 photos of great quality. A 2GB cards gives you 500+ photos. It's also a breeze to connect to the computer and with the 'photo tag' feature I can keep all my photos organized right on the camera. I really don't think you can go wrong with this camera because its so easy to use and the picture quality is excellent. Its also an attention-getter with the 'tap' technology.  This was a great buy!

Reviews.Title: HP Photosmart  R937 constantly freezes
Reviews.Author: Ed Moore
Reviews.Content: This camera was selected because it looked very user friendly, especially the LED touch-screen.  The first problem was the on/off switch jammed and the camera would not turn off.  I went on  HP live chat and the person could not understand my problem and was instructing me from a manual.  I finally was able to turn off the camera.  The touch screen constantly freezes and I have to turn the camera off, wait, and then restart it and hope that this does not happen again.  It does continue to happen and I am in the process of returning it to HP. I do not want a replacement!HP Photosmart R937 8MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom  Also, after inserting this product link, I notice that the price has dropped - I am not surprised!

Reviews.Title: Awesome, stylish camera for this price is a steal
Reviews.Author: Chaostar
Reviews.Content: *edit*Despite the stars I gave, this camera started acting up after about a year. The shutter sometimes closes and opens nonstop like it has a seizure. Definitely get a different camera. Steer clear from HP.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Charles Lannom
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a quality camera that did not require a lot of expertise and was very easy to use.  This camera is just that, the touch screen menu makes use a snap and the pictures and videos are excellent.  I would recommend it to anyone that doesn't know a lot about cameras, but wants to take great photos.

Reviews.Title: Really disappointed in picture quality
Reviews.Author: S. Woodhull
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the cool touchscreen--I wanted the biggest LCD I could find, and I really like that part, along with the in-camera editing features.  However, all the editing features don't save this camera from a huge design flaw, which is that they put the flash right over the lens!  The result is that most of the pictures I take using flash have those little white circles in them where the flash bounces off dust particles near the lens.  Most of my flash pictures aren't just poor, they're ruined!  Unfortunately, I take most of my pictures indoors, in low light.  HP Support was no help at all.  I would definitely not buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Really Wanted to Love It
Reviews.Author: MrJDubb
Reviews.Content: I tell you I really wanted to love this camera.  I think the touch screen and huge LCD are great innovations and make this camera fun and easy to use.  If all you are taking are pictures out on a sunny day, then this IS a great camera.  However, any type of inside shot or low light shots are awful.  A little noise is bearable.  However, there is so much noise in low light pictures using the R937, that even the best editing software can't do much to improve the shots.  Also, in my experience, the pet-eye reduction had no impact at all in shots of our dog.  The red-eye reduction feature on the camera works well, and that is good because you're going to need it!  The placement of the flash immediately above the lens was a design mistake in my opinion, because it washes out many of what would otherwise be a good picture.Again, if this camera is mainly for outdoor shots at the beach, you will be happy with the results.  If not, steer clear and buy something else.

Reviews.Title: Simply Everything
Reviews.Author: D. Collins
Reviews.Content: This is simply everything that I have ever wanted in a digital camera. I purchased this camera in August a week after it was on the market. I have waited until now to write a review because i wanted to fully test it. I LOVE this CAMERA. It has taken me from Vegas to Cali to VA Beach and all points in between. I have not had one bad picture. I was sold on the touch screen feature. My four year old can make mommy skinny on this camera or adjust red eye. It's that easy to use. After 6 months of using this camera..I would purchase it again and again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Low-res display, grainy pictures
Reviews.Author: M. Munroe "LabView Guru"
Reviews.Content: With all of the newer cameras getting bigger displays, this one seems to be on the cutting edge.  But unfortunately it falls way short.  The display appears to be a large, low resolution display that does not show much detail for an 8MP camera.  I think my 3MP Nikon with the 1.8" display was clearer.Also the pictures from the camera are unusually grainy.  I typically use PhotoShop's sharpen feature before I print my photos, but with this camera a solid-colored background jumps to life.  This is after I adjusted the parameters for the higher resolution.On the positive side, the videos came out great and I like the choice to make some settings permanent or not.  There was no difficulty downloading the pictures using the disk-mode.

Reviews.Title: HP937 Offers Large LCD Screen and Many Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: Bryan Carey "Bryan Carey"
Reviews.Content: The Hewlett- Packard Photosmart R937 Digital Camera is a slightly more advanced digital camera than the average with a few extra features that make some of the simpler digital cameras pale in comparison. I have owned a few different digital cameras in my day and with each purchase, I tend to look for more features in a more user- friendly package. This HP camera combines the features I had on my last Hewlett- Packard camera with a larger viewing screen and more photo effects for more advanced and more convenient photography.Hewlett- Packard Photosmart R937 Digital Camera offers many good reasons to rate it highly but among them, the one that caught my attention first was the huge LCD screen. Small viewing screens are a great annoyance with many digital cameras, but the LCD screen on the Hewlett- Packard Photosmart R937 Digital Camera measures a whopping 3.6 inches. In fact, it encompasses almost the entire back side of the camera and it provided exactly the extra viewing area I wanted. Not only does the large screen make it easy to capture images and clearly see the image you are about to take, it is also perfect for the playback of the video feature. With a screen this large, one can preview a video with ease. There is no need to strain the eyes when the LCD screen on your camera is 3.6 inches.This camera offers many different shooting modes to create just the right picture. Beach, landscape, snow, sunset, etc., are among the many choices and you need to just try each one out to find out which one works best for different situations. I also like the auto- shooting mode. Using this, the Hewlett- Packard Photosmart R937 Digital Camera becomes idiot proof. It will do its best to conform the image electronically, saving the user the time or hassle of seeking out just the right mode. Picture cleanup is also very fast with the Hewlett- Packard Photosmart R937 Digital Camera. The large LCD screen makes it easy to find problems and makes it easy to delete the problems with a touch of the screen.Is everything perfect with the Hewlett- Packard Photosmart R937 Digital Camera? No, there are a few problem areas. One is the lack of available memory. There is enough space on this camera to handle about 20 to 25 pictures. This isn't much at all, and it won't suffice for even the casual picture taker. This is why memory cards are a must with this camera. Another problem is with the zoom function. It doesn't zoom very wide, and it is also one of the few features of the Hewlett- Packard Photosmart R937 Digital Camera that is not activated by using the touch screen. Another small complaint is the time it takes to transfer pictures from the camera to your pc. The 1.1 USB connection isn't very fast, so you have to be patient as you wait for the pictures to flow from one device to the next.Perfect or near- perfect digital cameras may exist, but they will likely cost a week's wages or more and are not practical for the casual photographer. The Hewlett- Packard Photosmart R937 Digital Camera isn't perfect, but it does take plenty of great pictures, offers great editing, has a long battery life, and offers a gigantic LCD viewing area of 3.6 inches, all for a relatively low price. It's a winning digital camera in my book, giving you the minimum features you want plus a little bit more without the excessively high price tag common with the more sophisticated cameras.

Reviews.Title: Good, easy, point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Bran
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about 14 months now.  I carried it around in my jeans pocket for an entire year.  The camera is durable.  I dropped it a few times and have had it bang into all kinds of stuff while in my pocket.  After 12 months the plastic piece that holds the battery broke and the battery would push its door open.  I found that if I bent the door a little (it has a metal hinge) then it wouldn't be forced open by the battery.  I figured that after the wear and tear I put the camera through, that was a reasonable breakage.The one complaint I have is the software for connecting to a PC.  It doesn't really work.  The easiest thing is to not bother with it.  Just pull out the memory card and put it in your computer (or get a usb card reader if your computer doesn't have a built in one).  That will take just a min or two to get all the photos from your camera to the computer.  Then just put the card back in the camera and its good to go.The picture quality is good.  The camera does have trouble in low light if you don't use a flash.  But that is pretty typical of point and shoot camera.  Pictures from this camera seem to have more than average red eye, but that never bothered me.The big selling point for me was the internal lens.  When you focus, it adjusts inside the camera instead of extending out.  This way if the camera gets turned on in your pocket or purse the lens won't get damaged because it stays inside the camera.I also love the touch screen.  All cameras should have a UI like this one.  So much easier to use and figure out.  I recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: My  Photosmart
Reviews.Author: Giuseppe Bertoni
Reviews.Content: Just to say that this a wonderful product for its versatility ,max practice and quality .

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy
Reviews.Author: Bumble Bee "Bumblebee"
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviewer. Camera freezes. We have had to replace camera twice in 3 weeks and we are taking it back again in less than 30 days.  I hope to completely exchange this camera.Poor quality!!!

Reviews.Title: Problem Charging
Reviews.Author: Mayhem68
Reviews.Content: My camera wont hold a charge.I charge it all night by morning it reads 3/4 charged.it lets me set the date but when i start to set the time,it tells me that the battery is depleted and then it turns off.Can anyone help me fix this problem?

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: I've owned my camera for over a year now, and I completely love it!, the HUGE touch screen makes for ease of use, and the colors are very vibrant! I have had not problems of the camera freezing up, it has always been ready to takes pictures at a moments notice!

Reviews.Title: Great pictures except at night
Reviews.Author: SoSilly
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera despite it's flaws. It takes GREAT quality pictures during the day and there are many modes to choose from like beach, close up, portrait, etc. You can also edit your pictures before you upload it to your computer (make a border around the picture, fix blemishes, make a picture softer, crop, etc). It was my first touch screen gadget and I loved that feature, especially with the BIG display screen. The video feature allows you to zoom in while recording....some cameras don't have that feature.Now on to the drawbacks, it takes bad pictures at night or in low light settings and leaves a bunch of white spots all over your picture. The red eye does not always work. The camera will power off or freeze sometimes. The cover that reveals the lens when you power the camera on or hides the lens when you power the camera off stopped working. Luckily for me, my husband took the camera apart and fixed it. It takes FOREVER to upload pictures from the USB cable and sometimes it took several tries before I could upload all my pics, therefore, I just took the memory card out of the camera, popped it in my laptop, and transferred the pics. It was sooo much faster! The video feature has a very low sound.I've had my camera since 2007 and plan on keeping it to take pics during the day since it does such a great job but I'm going to buy another camera for night/low light pictures. The camera works well now except that the blue knob that holds the battery broke when I dropped my camera on the floor so I taped it shut.

Reviews.Title: HP Photosmart
Reviews.Author: S. MacDougall
Reviews.Content: The HP Photosmart R937 digital camera is the best camera I have ever owned.  It was disappointing to learn that HP stopped manufacturing them.  I was so glad to be able to find another on Amazon.com!  Thanks to Luke Childs, I received the camera in excellent condition with many accessories including a 4 GB memory stick!  Love it.

Reviews.Title: LOTS of problems with this camera!
Reviews.Author: M. Lytle
Reviews.Content: I also wanted to like this camera - and really like the touch screen and features.  However, I have had multiple problems and I've now gone through 2 cameras.1)  The cheap plastic thing inside the camera holding the battery in place broke - and then the battery would push the door open and pop out (I held it together with a rubber band).  HP replaced the whole camera when I called this in.  However, the second camera DID THE SAME THING, although fortunately, the door stays closed on the second one.2) Linking with my computer and downloading pictures has never properly worked - with neither camera that I have had.  We have windows software and you would think it would be easy, but the provided program locks up and I am not able to use it.  I can utilize another program to get pictures, but I cannot download any movies that I take.  We have a Sony camera as well and we have no issues with downloads, so I know that it is with this camera and not our computer.3) The camera also freezes on me and the on/off button gets frozen (the only solution to this is to briefly remove the battery!)4)  I'm done with this camera now - after 1 year of use, I'm replacing it with a Canon. I would not suggest buying this one.

Reviews.Title: Top-notch vendor and product
Reviews.Author: Samuel Shive
Reviews.Content: The HP R937 digital camera from Beach Camera is probably HP's very best, feature-packed, sleek, and powerful offering.  Its 8.0 MB picture sample is superb for everything from simple snapshots to more ambitious compositions, and the camera's built-in "design gallery" temps the user with special effects, touch-up, pet and red-eye reduction, and in-camera panoramic creation and stitching--more than any other camera in this price range can do.  The 3.6" touch screen (the whole back of the camera!) doubles as a viewing screen and a menu/settings system.  Simply put:  the best!  Beach Camera and Amazon make for a dependable, secure, speedy purchase as well.

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera!
Reviews.Author: Tiffany Brown "nicoletiffany"
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for about four months now and I love it!  I received this camera as a Christmas gift to replace my older Hp camera.  This camera is very cool.  It's touch screen works flawlessly.  The screen is so nice and big, it's perfect!  There are also so many options on the camera (red eye, pet eye, b&w;, color tones, etc), you don't even have to work with editing on the computer if you don't want to.  If you are an Hp lover (or if you're not, you will be!), you will love this camera.

Reviews.Title: connecting camera to computer
Reviews.Author: R. Brown "media person"
Reviews.Content: Recently purchased the HP Photosmart R937. We like the camera, however, after installing the software and physically connecting the camera to the computer, the computer does not recognize the camera so we cannot download photos. Have had online chat with a tech person at HP and have performed all suggestions with no success. The procedure should be simple, but it isn't.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING BUY ONE!
Reviews.Author: Esperanza Garcia "BEAUTYBUYER08"
Reviews.Content: I first bought this camera in the beg. of 08. My friend had it and immeditley i fell in love. This camera has so many unique things you can do like look ten lbs less or make yourself into a cartoon. i love how you can edit right on the screen! Everyone who sees this camera is amazed at how wonderful it is. I never really leave reviews so this really is good! Good luck with your new R937!! Ohhh by the way when I bought this camera it was about three hundred cheaper. Anyone else see the price jump?Hope Garcia.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional Quality Camera
Reviews.Author: Melinda E. Williamson "Swampwoman"
Reviews.Content: I bought the HP R937 for both my grandsons.  It take EXCELLENT quality pictures and is very easy to use!  Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Horrible camera
Reviews.Author: A. Peterson "ap"
Reviews.Content: This has got to be the worse camera I have ever used. I have given it a year of use and I am sorry to say that in all of 2008 I do not have one good photo that was taken indoors. All are grainy, red eye/glo eye, and tons of white spots on every photo. I threw the camera in the trash tonight after veiwing my x-mas photos.I also have never been able to download the photos from the camera had to use a USB card reader to tranfer them.I wasted a whole year of photos that I will never be able to replace. I would never recommend this to anyone.I have had it with HP--

Reviews.Title: Worst experience I have had with an HP product
Reviews.Author: Joel Horton
Reviews.Content: This camera has been one of my worst experiences I have had with a piece of consumer electronics.  I have had 2 of these cameras and the durability of the camera is absolutely horrible.  Both cameras have been irreparably damaged by a single drop.  The video quality exceeds the durability only slightly and is aweful.  The picture quality exceeds the video quality only slightly and is dreadful.  The camera delivers a very low picture quality in spite of the 8mp picture rating.  Mysterious halos appear in many of our pictures including the photos taken during my sons first Christmas and the birth of my second son. Also the photos lack a richness in color.  And the best part is the lack absolute lack of customer service delived by HP.  I have finally given up and purchased a Canon SD1100 IS which I cannot recommend enough.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful to look at - a nightmare to own
Reviews.Author: Sammicat "Sammi"
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous camera. I owned it for three days. On the third day I took it back to the store and got a full refund. The tiny latch on the battery door broke off. I gently closed it and felt something fall onto my hand. It was a piece of black plastic smaller than the end of a toothpick. The camera only comes with a quick-start guide. Other than that you have to access information on your computer after you install the disk that comes with the camera. Or, you can download a 64 page manual. I called tech-support and told them I did not want to use all of my black ink-jet to download the manual and asked if they could send me one,(this was before the battery door broke), they told me they do not do that. I also read reviews on other sites after my camera broke. Some complained of the same problem with the battery door others complained of other parts breaking within a week or two of owning it. Save your money and buy something else...

Take superior photos that can be cropped or enlarged with 8-megapixel resolution and Fujinon 3x optical zoom
32MB Internal Memory - We recommend purchasing a 1GB SD card
View photos easily, indoors or out, using an energy-efficient 3.6-inch Auto-bright Display
Edit and organize photos directly from the easy-to-use, interactive Touchscreen - no PC needed
Enjoy quick photo organization for easy sharing using the in-camera, Microsoft Vista-compatible tagging feature and Touchscreen menus
